title: Slingshot selected to design user experience for U.S. space traffic system
summary:
The company won a $5.3 million contract with options for four additional years, bringing the potential total value to $13.3 million 
The post Slingshot selected to design user experience for U.S. space traffic system appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: NASA Awards Contract for NOAA’s Next-Generation Space Weather Sensors
summary: NASA, on behalf of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), has selected Johns Hopkins University’s Applied Physics Laboratory of Laurel, Maryland, to build the Suprathermal Ion Sensors for the Lagrange 1 Series project, part of NOAA’s Space Weather Next Program. This cost-plus-fixed-fee contract is valued at approximately $20.5 million and includes the development of […]

title: NASA, USAID Invite Media to Launch of New SERVIR Central America Hub
summary: NASA and the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID) invite media to the official launch celebration of the new SERVIR Central America regional hub, located in Costa Rica, on Tuesday, Dec. 3, at 11 a.m. EST. The event will be hosted by NASA SERVIR Program Manager Daniel Irwin, U.S. Ambassador to El Salvador William H. […]

title: Selfie Time with Astronaut Victor Glover
summary: Employees at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida and NASA astronaut Victor Glover (right) happily snap a photo of themselves during a visit on Nov. 8, 2024. The employees are part of the agency’s Exploration Ground Systems (EGS), which develops and operates the systems and facilities needed to process and launch rockets and spacecraft for […]

title: NASA AI, Open Science Advance Natural Disaster Research and Recovery
summary: By Lauren Perkins When you think of NASA, disasters such as hurricanes may not be the first thing to come to mind, but several NASA programs are building tools and advancing science to help communities make more informed decisions for disaster planning.  Empowered by NASA’s commitment to open science, the NASA Disasters Program supports disaster […]

title: Discovery Alert: a ‘Hot Neptune’ in a Tight Orbit
summary: By Grace Jacobs Corban The Discovery A Neptune-sized planet, TOI-3261 b, makes a scorchingly close orbit around its host star. Only the fourth object of its kind ever found, the planet could reveal clues as to how planets such as these form. Key Facts An international team of scientists used the NASA space telescope, TESS […]

title: This Thanksgiving, We’re Grateful for NASA’s Amateur Scientists!
summary: This year, we’re giving thanks to you for Doing NASA Science! title: NASA Data Reveals Role of Green Spaces in Cooling Cities
summary: As any urban dweller who has lived through a heat wave knows, a shady tree can make all the difference. But what happens when there’s no shade available?
